performances.description: Not a lot of love for this DP 26.  This show and the next night are classic 69 shows.  BTW...this CC cooks.

performances.venue: Kings Beach Bowl Lake Tahoe , CA
performances.description: Heavy Metal meets Psychedelia - love these early China Cats!

performances.venue: Kings Beach Bowl Lake Tahoe, CA
performances.description: These early China Cat's just rip and then transition into 11 perfctly.
Jerry's early tone is sweetly acerbic, and pleases like the burn from a swig of crisp Coke on a hot day. Seamless transition into 'The Eleven'.

performances.venue: Seminole Indian Village West Hollywood, FL
performances.description: I usually prefer the China>Rider combo but this is a must hear version; Jerry really pours on the HEAT between the verses!!
simply the best
Short but smokin'
First time China Cat Sunflower.  Actually a 4:49 Dark Star>China Cat >The Eleven (1st time also) .  Very experimental and rocking version.
Dark Star > China Cat > Eleven pretty cool early experimental version. From the excellent "so many roads" box set
Raw '68 psychedelia with a burning hot Arabic vibe

performances.venue: Laguna Seca Recreation Area Monterey, CA
performances.description: China > Crazy Fingers = awesome
Killer power bridging Dark Star into an atomic The Eleven. Not kidding, but all the early ones belong up here to spread more heads into '68 Dead.
Nice early stand alone with a long intro. You can hear the transition from the old intro to the more familiar pickings of later versions.
Full of energy, very psychedelic
absolutely wonderful psychedelic gem fantastic one of the earliest China->Riders

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: energetic, loose, psychedelic, favorite 69 version
A curious Cat peekin' through some Good Lovin'. Not an epic CCS per se, but the transitions in 'n out are as smooth as a Michael Jordan layup. Unique.
Absolutely adore these early psychedelic chestnuts
Fantastic early version with a cool loose flute solo in the beginning.
Pure psychedelic pop bubbles up over the top and into Sittin on Top.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: very nice early stand alone version sweet melt into dew
Unique segue into Cumberland Blues. A nice little adventure away from the normal Rider.
Smmooookin' China Cat>Eleven transition!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Classic Dead - clean, clear, and in complete unison.  Fantastic version of this song - Jerry sounds amazing, and you can feel the energy throughout!
Strong China Cat! Hitting every note! Strong! Happy people all around!!
The China in this China Rider is simply amazing. Fantastic extra long jam before the Feelin' Groovy jam.

performances.venue: NY State Pavilion, Flushing Meadow Park Queens, NY
performances.description: Powerful
Nice psychedelic wish recording of this song were better as its a little muffled, but Jer is bringing it

performances.venue: Santa Cruz County Fairgrounds Watsonville, CA
performances.description: It's long & Jammed out 83' style 7:40 long!
Ancient roots with hard edged jams

performances.venue: Felt Forum - Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: China cat tease! NFA -> China Cat Jam (tease) -> Goin' down the road feelin' bad -> NFA
Pigs playing on all of these shows blew my mind away. Honestly thought it was Tom

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Many sweet moments!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Fun solo at the end of this solo Cat from the late show!
all of the funk and swing you could ever want from the dead. not to mention this was when jerry was using the gator and the audio quality is insane!
The boys had a real funky feel going this time round
